an8.53:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near Vesālī, at the Great Wood, in the hall with the peaked roof.
an8.53:1.2: Then Mahāpajāpatī Gotamī went up to the Buddha, bowed, stood to one side, and said to him:
an8.53:2.1: “Bhante, may the Buddha please teach me Dhamma in brief. When I’ve heard it, I’ll live alone, withdrawn, heedful, diligent, and resolute.”
an8.53:2.2: “Gotamī, the things that you would know
an8.53:2.6: to abundance of desires, not fewness of desires;
an8.53:2.10: to being burdensome, not being unburdensome.
an8.53:2.11: Categorically, you should remember these things as
an8.53:2.12: not the teaching, not the training, and not the Teacher’s instructions.
an8.53:3.1: “Gotamī, the things that you would know
an8.53:3.5: to fewness of desires, not abundance of desires;
an8.53:3.9: to being unburdensome, not being burdensome.
an8.53:3.10: Categorically, you should remember these things as
an8.53:3.11: the teaching, the training, and the Teacher’s instructions.”
